title: Cardno is latest firm to cut ties with Adani
text:
Engineering outfit Cardno has decided to cut ties with the Adani Carmichael coal mine in Queensland even as it continues to work with other fossil fuel projects.

The Brisbane-based company with more than 6000 staff globally cited Adani’s “polarising” impact on employees, its own customer base and the political environment for the move.

At Cardno’s annual general meeting in Sydney on Thursday chairman Michael Alscher said it would finish an existing project with a subcontractor working on Adani's Carmichael coal project within the next few weeks.

He added the company would then “not look for any work from a contractor or subcontractor on the Adani project”.

“There's a lot of concern internally within the business as to the whole project. And there’s a lot of concern raised by staff, as well as by other customers,” he said.

“I think we have to take a view whether we're standing [with] one group of customers or whether we're going to stand with another group of customers.”
description: Cardno has joined the list of businesses backing away from work on Adani's Carmichael coal project in Queensland.
